anvil.description:
A simple anvil.
You can upgrade your tools with it.
anvil.mail: Found this tucked away in the guild's backroom and while you're not a blacksmith, I'm sure you can figure out how to upgrade your tools with it.^^^  -Marlon^^P.S. Let's keep this between us. No need for Clint to find out. %item id {{item}} 1 %%
anvil.page.title: Smithing Notes
anvil.page.body: Smithing Manual^^With the anvil you can improve tools or break geodes.^^How To Use:^Hold the tool you wish to improve and carry the required resources. Precision is your aim, missing will waste your materials.^^^Axe Upgrades:^*Base Axe > Copper Axe: {{Axe_0_amount}} x {{Axe_0_item}}^*Copper Axe > Steel Axe: {{Axe_1_amount}} x {{Axe_1_item}}^*Steel Axe > Gold Axe: {{Axe_2_amount}} x {{Axe_2_item}}^*Gold Axe > Iridium Axe: {{Axe_3_amount}} x {{Axe_3_item}}^^Pickaxe Upgrades:^*Base Pickaxe > Copper Pickaxe: {{Pickaxe_0_amount}} x {{Pickaxe_0_item}}^*Copper Pickaxe > Steel Pickaxe: {{Pickaxe_1_amount}} x {{Pickaxe_1_item}}^*Steel Pickaxe > Gold Pickaxe: {{Pickaxe_2_amount}} x {{Pickaxe_2_item}}^*Gold Pickaxe > Iridium Pickaxe: {{Pickaxe_3_amount}} x {{Pickaxe_3_item}}^Hoe Upgrades:^*Base Hoe > Copper Hoe: {{Hoe_0_amount}} x {{Hoe_0_item}}^*Copper Hoe > Steel Hoe: {{Hoe_1_amount}} x {{Hoe_1_item}}^*Steel Hoe > Gold Hoe: {{Hoe_2_amount}} x {{Hoe_2_item}}^*Gold Hoe > Iridium Hoe: {{Hoe_3_amount}} x {{Hoe_3_item}}^^Watering Can Upgrades:^*Base Can > Copper Can: {{WateringCan_0_amount}} x {{WateringCan_0_item}}^*Copper Can > Steel Can: {{WateringCan_1_amount}} x {{WateringCan_1_item}}^*Steel Can > Gold Can: {{WateringCan_2_amount}} x {{WateringCan_2_item}}^*Gold Can > Iridium Can: {{WateringCan_3_amount}} x {{WateringCan_3_item}}^^Trash Can Upgrades (hold any trash item):^*Base > Copper: {{Trash_0_amount}} x {{Trash_0_item}} ^*Copper > Steel: {{Trash_1_amount}} x {{Trash_1_item}}^*Steel > Gold: {{Trash_2_amount}} x {{Trash_2_item}}^*Gold > Iridium: {{Trash_3_amount}} x {{Trash_3_item}}^^Pan Upgrades:^*Pan > Steel Pan: {{Pan_1_amount}} x {{Pan_1_item}}^*Steel Pan > Gold Pan: {{Pan_2_amount}} x {{Pan_2_item}}^*Gold Pan > Iridium Pan: {{Pan_3_amount}} x {{Pan_3_item}}^^Fishing Rod Upgrades:^*Bamboo Pole > Training Rod: {{Rod_0_amount}} x {{Rod_0_item}}^*Training Rod > Fiberglass Rod: {{Rod_1_amount}} x {{Rod_1_item}}^*Fiberglass Rod > Iridium Rod: {{Rod_2_amount}} x {{Rod_2_item}}^*Iridium Rod > Advanced Iridium Rod: {{Rod_3_amount}} x {{Rod_3_item}}^^Scythe Upgrades:^*Scythe > Golden Scythe: {{Scythe_0_amount}} x {{Scythe_0_item}}^*Golden Scythe > Iridium Scythe: {{Scythe_1_amount}} x {{Scythe_1_item}}^^Backpack Expansions:^*First expansion: {{Bag_12_amount}} x {{Bag_12_item}}^*Second expansion: {{Bag_24_amount}} x {{Bag_24_item}}^^Breaking Stones:^*Bring a geode or mystery box to the anvil to break them open.^^^^^Trinket Upgrade:^*Cost: {{Trinket_0_amount}} x {{Trinket_0_item}}^*Upgrading will always result in a better version of the trinket used (original ranks and requirements still apply)^*Magic Quivers can be upgraded to either Rapid, Heavy or Perfect, which is the highest rank and cannot be upgraded further^^^^^Higher skills can help with the upgrading process:^*Foraging skill: Axe^*Mining skill: Pickaxe and Pan^*Farming skill: Hoe and Watering Can^*Fishing skill: Fishing Rod^*Combat skill: Trinket^*Overall experience: Trash Can and Backpack
anvil.page.body.no-training-rod: Smithing Manual^^With the anvil you can improve tools or break geodes.^^How To Use:^Hold the tool you wish to improve and carry the required resources. Precision is your aim, missing will waste your materials.^^^^Axe Upgrades:^*Base Axe > Copper Axe: {{Axe_0_amount}} x {{Axe_0_item}}^*Copper Axe > Steel Axe: {{Axe_1_amount}} x {{Axe_1_item}}^*Steel Axe > Gold Axe: {{Axe_2_amount}} x {{Axe_2_item}}^*Gold Axe > Iridium Axe: {{Axe_3_amount}} x {{Axe_3_item}}^^Pickaxe Upgrades:^*Base Pickaxe > Copper Pickaxe: {{Pickaxe_0_amount}} x {{Pickaxe_0_item}}^*Copper Pickaxe > Steel Pickaxe: {{Pickaxe_1_amount}} x {{Pickaxe_1_item}}^*Steel Pickaxe > Gold Pickaxe: {{Pickaxe_2_amount}} x {{Pickaxe_2_item}}^*Gold Pickaxe > Iridium Pickaxe: {{Pickaxe_3_amount}} x {{Pickaxe_3_item}}^Hoe Upgrades:^*Base Hoe > Copper Hoe: {{Hoe_0_amount}} x {{Hoe_0_item}}^*Copper Hoe > Steel Hoe: {{Hoe_1_amount}} x {{Hoe_1_item}}^*Steel Hoe > Gold Hoe: {{Hoe_2_amount}} x {{Hoe_2_item}}^*Gold Hoe > Iridium Hoe: {{Hoe_3_amount}} x {{Hoe_3_item}}^^Watering Can Upgrades:^*Base Can > Copper Can: {{WateringCan_0_amount}} x {{WateringCan_0_item}}^*Copper Can > Steel Can: {{WateringCan_1_amount}} x {{WateringCan_1_item}}^*Steel Can > Gold Can: {{WateringCan_2_amount}} x {{WateringCan_2_item}}^*Gold Can > Iridium Can: {{WateringCan_3_amount}} x {{WateringCan_3_item}}^^Trash Can Upgrades (hold any trash item):^*Base > Copper: {{Trash_0_amount}} x {{Trash_0_item}} ^*Copper > Steel: {{Trash_1_amount}} x {{Trash_1_item}}^*Steel > Gold: {{Trash_2_amount}} x {{Trash_2_item}}^*Gold > Iridium: {{Trash_3_amount}} x {{Trash_3_item}}^^Pan Upgrades:^*Pan > Steel Pan: {{Pan_1_amount}} x {{Pan_1_item}}^*Steel Pan > Gold Pan: {{Pan_2_amount}} x {{Pan_2_item}}^*Gold Pan > Iridium Pan: {{Pan_3_amount}} x {{Pan_3_item}}^^Fishing Rod Upgrades:^*Bamboo Pole > Fiberglass Rod: {{Rod_1_amount}} x {{Rod_1_item}}^*Fiberglass Rod > Iridium Rod: {{Rod_2_amount}} x {{Rod_2_item}}^*Iridium Rod > Advanced Iridium Rod: {{Rod_3_amount}} x {{Rod_3_item}}^^Scythe Upgrades:^*Scythe > Golden Scythe: {{Scythe_0_amount}} x {{Scythe_0_item}}^*Golden Scythe > Iridium Scythe: {{Scythe_1_amount}} x {{Scythe_1_item}}^^^Backpack Expansions:^*First expansion: {{Bag_12_amount}} x {{Bag_12_item}}^*Second expansion: {{Bag_24_amount}} x {{Bag_24_item}}^^Breaking Stones:^*Bring a geode or mystery box to the anvil to break them open.^^^^^Trinket Upgrade:^*Cost: {{Trinket_0_amount}} x {{Trinket_0_item}}^*Upgrading will always result in a better version of the trinket used (original ranks and requirements still apply)^*Magic Quivers can be upgraded to either Rapid, Heavy or Perfect, which is the highest rank and cannot be upgraded further^^^^Higher skills can help with the upgrading process:^*Foraging skill: Axe^*Mining skill: Pickaxe and Pan^*Farming skill: Hoe and Watering Can^*Fishing skill: Fishing Rod^*Combat skill: Trinket^*Overall experience: Trash Can and Backpack
tool.cant-upgrade: I don’t think this can be upgraded at all.
tool.empty: You need to equip a tool.
tool.disabled: I can’t improve this tool any further at its current level.
tool.max-level: This tool is already at the highest upgrade level.
tool.missing-materials: You need {{ItemAmount}} {{itemName}} to perform the upgrade.
tool.upgraded-critical: Your {{toolType}} was upgraded with maximum efficiency!
geode.menu-desc:
Opening geodes... How hard can it be?

I can do it myself!
menu.allow-fail-tooltip: Lose materials without upgrading your tool.
menu.material-text: Enter Item IDs and quantities. Set quantity to 0 for free upgrades.
